intro: Zanha golungensis, commonly known as the East African zanha, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of East Africa. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes many shrubs and small trees. The plant is characterized by its simple, opposite leaves and clusters of small, white or pale yellow flowers. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories. Zanha golungensis is not widely cultivated but is of interest to botanists due to its unique morphology and ecological role.
